recordTypes.name: Verification Form
recordTypes.description:
This form is required for the following categories: 
-Non-profit food vendors are exempt due to the 501C3 tax exemption status such as
churches, civic and political organizations
-Some food manufacturing that is not retail or packaged foods are inspected under the jurisdiction of the Department of Agriculture. View a chart to help you decide (PDF).
-Establishments are exempt from temporary food event permit. Vendors who sell items that are prepared and individually packaged at a permitted food service establishment are not required to have a TFE permit.
-Mobile food units that hold a foodservice permit and return to the commissary daily are exempt from a temporary food regulations.

recordTypes.name: Trade Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for Residential and/or Commercial Electrical/HVAC/Plumbing Trade Only Permits

recordTypes.name: Creating a Portal Account
recordTypes.description: This section will provide info on setting up your Portal Account to apply, pay, schedule and track permits.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Compliance Certificate - Residential
recordTypes.description: Pittsboro Zoning Compliance Certificate for residential developments. Includes: new residential dwelling, replacing residential dwelling, relocating residential dwelling, accessory dwelling, fence, pool, solar panels (roof and ground mounted), accessory structures, additions.

recordTypes.name: Siler City Flood Plain Determination
recordTypes.description: Floodplain determination for Environmental Health approvals.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Compliance Certificate - Non-Residential
recordTypes.description: Pittsboro Zoning Compliance for non-residential requests: ex. new business, expansion of business, relocating business, change of tenant, solar panels (roof and ground mounted), accessory structures, additions.

recordTypes.name: Affidavit (for septic systems) -
recordTypes.description: The affidavit can only be submitted for confirming wastewater (septic) system setbacks. An affidavit cannot be used for wells or for projects that increase the wastewater flow or wastewater strength. If a well is located on the property, a well setback approval will be required to confirm well setbacks.

recordTypes.name: Alcohol Beverage (ABC) Zoning Permit
recordTypes.description:
This Permit request is ONLY for establishments that are subject to County Zoning.   Any ABC requests in municipalities should obtain zoning approval from that jurisdiction. 
(Separate application for Building and Fire Inspections must be made in all cases) See ABC Inspection Request under Permits & Inspections.

recordTypes.name: Siler City Sign Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Permit to allow the placement of signs within the Siler City Planning Jurisdiction in accordance with the Siler City Unified Development Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Construction Drawings
recordTypes.description: Construction Drawing review for projects

recordTypes.name: Residential New Building Permit
recordTypes.description:
Application for a Residential Building Permit for the following NEW structures:
Single Family Dwelling, Townhouse/Attached SF Dwelling, Duplex, Addition (Covered area), Modular Home

recordTypes.name: Residential Accessory Structure Permit
recordTypes.description:
Application for permitting residential accessory structures.  Examples include:detached garage, shed, storage building, retaining wall, carport, etc.  Structures which are detached from dwelling.                


Accessory Dwelling(s) should use Residential New Building permit, Uncovered decks/ramps or access to dwelling should use Deck permit.  This permit cannot be used for commercial uses, apartments or multi-family dwellings.

recordTypes.name: Applying and making Payments through Portal Account
recordTypes.description:
2. Applying for a Permit & Paying Fees
Applying for a Permit

Start an Application:

First, you must have a profile. Please see 1. Signing Up, Creating a Profile, & Accessing Your Information for more information.

To navigate to a specific application, click on Explore next to the Department or Category name. Then click Select next to the type of permit. Lastly click Start to start the application. At that time, you'll be prompted to log in (if you have not already logged in) and can apply for your permit or license.

Saving Drafts:

Applications can be saved as Drafts and completed at a later time. To save your application, click on Save and Exit on the upper right side of the form. 

To return to that Draft:

1. Go to your Profile

2. In the Active Records section, click on the Record. All Draft records will be labeled "Draft."



Paying a Fee

When a fee is due, you'll be notified automatically via email.

To pay:

1. In the email notification, click on Pay Online. You can also go to the site, view your profile, and click on the Record in your Inbox.

2. In the Permit Fee step on the Record page, you'll see an overview of the fees and you'll be able to pay automatically with a credit card or e-check.

3. Click on Pay to pay the fee then follow the prompts to enter and submit your payment details.

recordTypes.name: Encroachment Agreement
recordTypes.description: Engineering encroachment agreement. Application upload still required.

recordTypes.name: Exempt and Minor Subdivision Review
recordTypes.description: Exempt and Minor Plat Review on subdivisions within the Siler City Planning Jurisdictions

recordTypes.name: Septic System Permitting - (Public Option ) Improvement Permit/Construction Authorization NEW
recordTypes.description: Health Department conducts the site visit and issues the permit.   (This is also for REPAIR permits to existing septic systems).

recordTypes.name: Septic System Permitting  (Hybrid Option)  (a2)
recordTypes.description:
Before submitting please confirm that the submittal is for an (a2) permit.
An (a2) requires an LSS or an AOWE to submit the Improvement permit and/or construction authorization permit to the health department for issuance.

recordTypes.name: Agricultural/Timber Exemption - Erosion Control
recordTypes.description: This application is only to be used for exempt activities as described in Section 164.04(B) of the Chatham County Soil Erosion and Sedimentation Control Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Floodplain Determination
recordTypes.description: Pittsboro Floodplain Determination

recordTypes.name: Receiving and Printing Documents
recordTypes.description:
3. Receiving Your Permit or Other Document
Receiving your Permit, License, or Other Documents

When a plan review, permit, license, certificate of occupancy, certificate of completion, or any other document is issued, the applicant will be notified automatically via email.

To Print Your Document 

In the email, click on the Print button. This will take you to the Record page. You can also log in to the OpenGov Citizen Services Cloud site, go to your Profile, and click on the Record.

On the Record page, click on the Document Issuance step and click Print (toward the bottom right of the preview).

recordTypes.name: Residential Alteration/Repair Permit
recordTypes.description:
Application for residential alteration and repair permit.  This permit cannot be used to add any new area (including decks) to an existing home/building and cannot be used for apartments or multi-family dwellings.

Examples include: foundation repair, finishing off an existing unfished bonus room or basement, truss repair from storm damage, reconfiguring an existing space into a different use (i.e. converting a closet into a bathroom).

recordTypes.name: Residential Mobile Home Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for Residential Mobile Home Building Permits.

recordTypes.name: Guest Portal Access
recordTypes.description: New! Add additional guest applicants to a record.

recordTypes.name: Home Occupation Permit
recordTypes.description: Home Occupation Permit application

recordTypes.name: Septic System Permitting - (Private Option) EOP or AOWE
recordTypes.description:
Before submitting please confirm that the submittal is for EOP or AOWE private option permitting.


EOP or AOWE private permitting options  require the engineer or LSS to submit a Notice of Intent (NOI) and an Authorization to Operate (ATO) to the health department.  The health department has minimal involvement in EOP/AOWE beyond the notification.

recordTypes.name: Existing System Approval or Well Setback Compliance NEW
recordTypes.description:
An Existing System Approval (ESA) is required for properties served by a wastewater system prior to reconnecting to the existing wastewater system or making any other additions to the property. 

Affidavit - Instead of receiving an ESA from the Health Department an owner of a property can choose to submit an Affidavit confirming that the proposed construction will meet local and state on-site wastewater system setback requirements pursuant to NCGS 130A-335 as long as the construction does not increase the design daily flow or wastewater strength. 

NOTE - The affidavit can only be submitted for confirming wastewater system setbacks.  If a well is located on the property, a well setback approval will be required to confirm well setbacks. 

A Well Setback Compliance Approval is needed when an improvement is being made to a parcel of land with an existing well to verify setbacks from the well are met. (Well Setback Compliance Approval is not needed if an existing system approval is submitted for the improvements.)

recordTypes.name: Commercial New Building Permit
recordTypes.description:
Application for a Commercial Building Permit for the following: any NEW buildings, structures, or additions. 
This application includes approvals from Environmental Health - Food & Lodging, please include Food Service, Educational, Institutional and Lodging applications with this building permit.

recordTypes.name: On-Site Verification of Surface Waters and Riparian Buffers
recordTypes.description: This application is for surface waters, and riparian buffers by Town staff. It includes stream determination.

recordTypes.name: Home Occupation Permit
recordTypes.description: This is for neighborhood and rural home occupations. This permit does not exclude the operator from obtaining approvals from other departments as required.

recordTypes.description: This application should only be used for new subdivision development applications that are 49 lots or less. This is an application that is required for the development phase of a subdivision and is not required for individual home building.

recordTypes.name: Rezoning Application - General Rezoning, Conditional Rezoning, Special Use Permits
Commercial Alteration Building Permit
recordTypes.description:
Application for a Commercial Alteration Building Permit for the following: any change (other than addition) in the building that has a construction cost over $40,000; or any of the following - any structural work, change of occupancy or change of tenant, even if no work is performed.  Any trade work should be done with this permit.       
This application includes approvals from Environmental Health - Food & Lodging, please include Food Service, Educational, Institutional and Lodging applications with this building permit.

Application for Residential and Commercial Swimming Pools, including Hot Tubs or similar. 

Any water feature such as fountains or man-made water features that have a pool depth over 24" is required to have this permit.

recordTypes.description: Application for permitting of Residential and Commercial decks, stairs, ramps or other structures without a roof.  Only for uncovered structures which are attached or used for access from building.

recordTypes.name: ABC Inspection Request
recordTypes.description: This application should be used to request an ABC inspection from the Building & Fire Official to sign the ABC form.   This request will not be accepted until you have Zoning approval from the Authority having Jurisdiction.  Please upload form provided by ABC and signed by Zoning.  Inspections cannot be scheduled until after a CO is issued for the space.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description:
Application for Sign Permits with or without lighting.    

Signs that are not illuminated and can easily be removed from a wall or painted over do not require a permit.  For example: a No Parking sign affixed to a building wall.

recordTypes.name: Subdivision Plat Review Application
recordTypes.description: Plat Review Application for properties within the Town of Pittsboro's planning jurisdiction. Use this application when submitting preliminary or final plats of any type (e.g., minor subdivision, major subdivision, exempt plat,  plat of correction).

recordTypes.name: Retaining Wall Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for permitting of Commercial retaining walls.  This permit is for walls that are located in the common area in residential subdivisions/apartments or commercial buildings.  This permit is NOT to be used for retaining walls totally located on a single lot that is for a single dwelling or duplex - Please use Residential Accessory Permit.

recordTypes.name: Fuel Storage Tank Removal, Installation, and Abandonment  Permit
recordTypes.description:
This Permit is required for the removal or abandonment of any underground or aboveground fuel storage tank(s) in Chatham County.  This shall apply to residential and commercial properties.  

Applicant Requirements:
The work area and equipment must be secured at all times. The Fire Marshal’s Office must be notified a minimum of seventy-two (72) hours prior to the requested date of removal. A complete closure report, including but not limited to a certified soil testing report, hazardous materials manifest, and tank disposal receipt must be submitted to the Fire Marshal's Office upon completion of the job. It shall be the responsibility of the person(s) conducting the removal of the tank to adhere to all procedures as outlined in the State of North Carolina Regulations, NFPA 30 and 327, as well as with the regulations of any other State or Federal Agency. IF THERE IS EVIDENCE OF A RELEASE OF PRODUCT, REGARDLESS OF THE AMOUNT RELEASED, YOU ARE REQUIRED TO NOTIFY THE PROPER AUTHORITIES.

recordTypes.name: Foster Home Inspection
recordTypes.description: This application form is used for applying for Foster Home licensing inspection.

recordTypes.name: Water Sample
recordTypes.description:
Please read below: You can’t pay until we approve the application & enter the fee!! 
Apply to have a water sample taken at your property. This is a three step process. 
1)Choose the type sample to be taken & upload your application (you can not pay at this point).
2)We review/approve your application & add the fee(s). 
3)You get a notification to your email to make the payment.

recordTypes.name: Well Permit
recordTypes.description: Well permit application

recordTypes.name: Blasting Operational Permit
recordTypes.description: An operational permit is required for the manufacture, storage, handling, sale or use of any quantity of explosives, explosive materials, fireworks or pyrotechnic special effects within the scope of Chapter 56 of the N.C. Fire Prevention Code. Exception: 1. Fireworks allowed by N.C.G.S. 12-414, 2. Storage in Group R-3 occupancies of smokeless propellant and small arms primers for personal use, not for resale and in accordance with Section 5606.

recordTypes.name: Event / Festival Permit
recordTypes.description:
This permit applies to the same events that had to obtain permits or approvals in the past: large outdoor public events, such as fairs, carnivals, street festivals or similar events involving tents, air-supported structures (inflatables), food sales, art shows, outdoor musical performances or plays, and fireworks displays.
**PLEASE NOTE THAT ADDITIONAL PERMITS MAY BE REQUIRED**

recordTypes.name: Goldston Recreation Fee Chatham Central School District
Tent and Temporary Structure Permit
recordTypes.description:
Permit submittals shall be 10 business days in advance of the event. Zoning and building approval is required. The structure(s) shall not be erected for a period of more than 180 consecutive days with in a 12-month period on a single premises.  Multiple tents at the SAME LOCATION may be permitted on a single permit. 

Each tent permit packet will be forwarded to a Fire Inspector who will be handling the issuance of your tent permit. We will review the submitted information and contact you if additional information is required. Once the submittal has been approved, the fire department will contact you to arrange for an on-site inspection. All applicable fees will be paid prior to the actual site inspection. Upon successful completion of the on-site inspection, the tent permit will be issued.

recordTypes.name: Fireworks / Pyrotechnic Special Effects Permit
recordTypes.description: An operational permit is required for the manufacture, storage, handling, sale or use of any quantity of explosives, explosive materials, fireworks or pyrotechnic special effects within the scope of Chapter 56 of the N.C. Fire Prevention Code. Exception: 1. Fireworks allowed by N.C.G.S. 12-414, 2. Storage in Group R-3 occupancies of smokeless propellant and small arms primers for personal use, not for resale and in accordance with Section 5606.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Fireworks Vendor Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for any vendor, temporary or permanent, that will be selling consumer fireworks in Chatham County.
